instruction: In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a marinade.
title: Prepare Marinade

transcript_segments.text: If you're a beginner at cooking or want to make the perfect Hyderabadi Kacchi Gosht-style Chicken Dum Biryani, then this recipe is for you. We’ll make a very delicious and perfect Chicken Dum Biryani using simple home spices.

We’ll make this recipe with 1.5 kg of rice and 1.5 kg of chicken. First, take 1.5 cups of oil and heat it. Into the hot oil, add 500 grams of thinly sliced onions. Fry the onions on medium to high flame until golden.

Once the oil has cooled down, we’ll add 1.5 kg of chicken to it. I’ve used slightly bigger pieces of chicken, but you can use smaller pieces if you prefer. Now, for the whole spices, take 12 green cardamoms, 10 cloves, and 10 kabab chini (cubebs).

Add 3 tablespoons of ginger-garlic paste. Add 1 cup of well-whisked yogurt. Add the fried onions — about 1 cup full or two handfuls. Add one handful of mint leaves and one handful of coriander leaves.

Add 5 to 6 whole green chilies. Add 1 teaspoon of cumin powder, 1 teaspoon of coriander powder, 1 teaspoon of spicy red chili powder, half a teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala powder, and salt according to the 1.5 kg quantity.

instruction: Add chicken pieces to the marinade along with green chilies, half of the mint and coriander leaves. Mix thoroughly and cover. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
title: Marinate Chicken

transcript_segments.text: Squeeze half a lemon into this mixture. Now mix everything thoroughly. Let the chicken marinate with the spices for at least 2 hours. If you have time, marinate the chicken overnight for best results.

instruction: Thinly slice the onions. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat and fry the onions in batches until golden brown and crispy.
title: Slice and Fry Onions

transcript_segments.text: Squeeze half a lemon into this mixture. Now mix everything thoroughly. Let the chicken marinate with the spices for at least 2 hours. If you have time, marinate the chicken overnight for best results.

instruction: Remove fried onions and place on paper towels to absorb excess oil. Set aside half for layering later.
title: Drain Fried Onions

transcript_segments.text: Squeeze half a lemon into this mixture. Now mix everything thoroughly. Let the chicken marinate with the spices for at least 2 hours. If you have time, marinate the chicken overnight for best results.

instruction: Mix the remaining half of the fried onions into the marinated chicken.
title: Add Onions to Marinade

transcript_segments.text: Squeeze half a lemon into this mixture. Now mix everything thoroughly. Let the chicken marinate with the spices for at least 2 hours. If you have time, marinate the chicken overnight for best results.

instruction: Rinse basmati rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
title: Rinse and Soak Rice

transcript_segments.text: Squeeze half a lemon into this mixture. Now mix everything thoroughly. Let the chicken marinate with the spices for at least 2 hours. If you have time, marinate the chicken overnight for best results.

instruction: Warm the milk slightly and add saffron strands. Let it sit for 10–15 minutes to release color and aroma.
title: Prepare Saffron Milk

transcript_segments.text: Squeeze half a lemon into this mixture. Now mix everything thoroughly. Let the chicken marinate with the spices for at least 2 hours. If you have time, marinate the chicken overnight for best results.

instruction: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add salt and whole spices (cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, cinnamon, star anise, peppercorns).
title: Boil Water with Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: Add the whole spices again. Also add green chilies, some coriander leaves, and mint leaves. Squeeze the juice of half a lemon again. Add the lemon peels as well. Add 2 tablespoons of salt.

instruction: Drain soaked rice and add it to the boiling spiced water. Cook until the rice is 70% done—grains should still be slightly firm. Drain the rice immediately.
title: Parboil the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Add the rice and gently stir it once with a spoon. As soon as the rice starts to boil, let it cook in the boiling water for just 3 minutes. For Kacchi Gosht Dum Biryani, the rice should not be cooked more than 70-80%.

instruction: Grease the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with a little ghee. Spread the marinated chicken evenly as the bottom layer.
title: Prepare for Layering

transcript_segments.text: Now transfer it all to a large pot in which we’ll cook the biryani. It’s best if the pot has a thick bottom. If your pot has a thin bottom, place a tawa (griddle) underneath it while cooking on dum.

instruction: Spread the parboiled rice evenly over the chicken layer.
title: Layer the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 cup of hot water directly into the chicken along with the rice. Spread the chicken evenly. Add half a teaspoon of garam masala powder to the fried onions. Mix it well and spread this over the chicken.

instruction: Top with the reserved fried onions, remaining mint and coriander leaves, saffron milk, and drizzle with ghee.
title: Add Final Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: I’ve taken 1/4 teaspoon of saffron and 1/4 teaspoon of yellow food color, mixed well, and added it on top of the rice. Also, add some of the fried onions mixed with garam masala here.

instruction: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid or seal the edges with dough to trap steam inside.
title: Seal the Pot

transcript_segments.text: Now we need to seal the pot. I’m using aluminum foil so the biryani cooks well with steam. You can also use dough to seal the pot. After applying foil, cover with the lid.

instruction: Place the sealed pot on high heat for 5 minutes. Then reduce to very low heat and let cook (dum) for 25–30 minutes.
title: Cook on High and Low Heat

transcript_segments.text: Now we need to seal the pot. I’m using aluminum foil so the biryani cooks well with steam. You can also use dough to seal the pot. After applying foil, cover with the lid.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani sit for 10 minutes to settle and absorb flavors.
title: Rest the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: Now cook the biryani on dum (low flame) for one hour. Once the biryani is properly cooked on dum, remove the lid. After cooking, insert a spoon like this to check if water is at the bottom.

instruction: Gently fluff the rice with a flat spoon without breaking the grains. Serve hot with raita, salad, or mirchi ka salan.
title: Serve

transcript_segments.text: As soon as I removed the lid and foil, a wonderful aroma spread throughout the house. Gently mix the rice from bottom to top so that the spices and chicken mix well with the rice. This is the Hyderabadi...
Serve this Hyderabadi Dum Biryani with yogurt raita or chutney.
